name: HD 132406
scenarioDescription:
The HD 132406 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 132406 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.34 times its radius. It is located 231.34 light years away from the solar system.

HD 132406 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 132406 system


HD 132406 b

HD 132406 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.98 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 132406 b is 1710.84 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 132406 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 132406, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Haute-Provence Observatory.
